meanings.definition: (Latin) I manage, I direct, I govern
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) First-person singular present active indicative of administrō: I manage, I direct, I govern.

etymology.value: From the Latin verb 'administrō', meaning 'to manage, direct, govern, control'. It is composed of 'ad-' (to, toward) and 'ministrō' (to serve, attend to), which itself comes from 'minister' (servant).

usage_notes.explanation: 'Administrō' is the first-person singular present active indicative form of the Latin verb 'administrō'. It is used when the speaker is actively managing, directing, or governing something in the present.

level_frequency.frequency_google_ngram: Low (in modern usage, as it is a Latin word)

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word. Understanding it requires knowledge of Latin grammar and vocabulary. It is the first-person singular present active indicative of the verb 'administrō', meaning 'I manage'.
